titleInfo.title: USA v. Washington et al
titleInfo.subTitle: PRELIMINARY ORDER OF FORFEITURE sustaining 28 Motion for Preliminary Forfeiture. The US Marshal is authorized to seize the $1,390.00 in US currency. Defendant's interest in said property is forfeited to the USA. Upon adjudication of all third-party interests, this Court will enter a Final Order of Forfeiture as to Marshall J. Washington (1). Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom. Certified copy to the USM. (JSF)

titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 40 motion to continue as to Marshall J. Washington (1) - Sentencing set for 11/15/2007 09:30 AM in Courtroom 5 (Omaha) before Senior Judge Lyle E. Strom. Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom. (JDR)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cr-00156; USA v. Washington et al;

extension.docketText: ORDER granting 40 motion to continue as to Marshall J. Washington (1) - Sentencing set for 11/15/2007 09:30 AM in Courtroom 5 (Omaha) before Senior Judge Lyle E. Strom. Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom. (JDR)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Washington et al
titleInfo.subTitle: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the $1,390.00 in United States currency, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The $1,390.00 in United States currency, be, and the same hereby is, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law, as to Marshall J. Washington (1). Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom. Certified copy USM. (JAE, ) Modified on 10/4/2007 to correct judge's name. (JAE, ).

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cr-00156; USA v. Washington et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: FINAL ORDER OF FORFEITURE - Plaintiff's Motion for Final Order of Forfeiture is hereby sustained. All right, title and interest in and to the $1,390.00 in United States currency, held by any person or entity, is hereby forever barred and foreclosed. The $1,390.00 in United States currency, be, and the same hereby is, forfeited to the United States of America. The United States Marshal for the District of Nebraska is directed to dispose of said property in accordance with law, as to Marshall J. Washington (1). Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom. Certified copy USM. (JAE, ) Modified on 10/4/2007 to correct judge's name. (JAE, ).

titleInfo.title: USA v. Washington et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Marshall J. Washington (1), Defendant plead guilty to Counts I and II of the Information and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for 66 months; 4 years supervised release with special conditions; $100 special assessment; the Indictment is dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only; final order of forfeiture filed on 8/27/07 as to Count IV as to defendant Marshall J. Washington. Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom. (4 certified copies to USM)(CJP)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cr-00156; USA v. Washington et al;

Washington. Ordered by Judge Lyle E. Strom. (4 certified copies to USM)(CJP)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Washington et al
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to Paul Burks, III (3), Defendant plead guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is committed to the Bureau of Prisons for 60 months; 4 years supervised release with special conditions; $100 special assessment; Counts II and III of the Indictment are dismissed on the motion of the United States as to this defendant only; defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons before 2:00 p.m. on February 4, 2008 as to defendant Paul Burks, III. Ordered by Senior Judge Lyle E. Strom. (4 certified copies to USM)(CJP)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Washington et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER REGARDING MOTION TO REDUCE SENTENCE UNDER 2011 CRACK COCAINE GUIDELINE AMENDMENT - granting 86 motion to reduce sentence under 2011 Crack Cocaine guideline amendment and the stipulation of the parties 87 is approved and adopted. The sentence of the defendant is reduced to sixty (60) months. Defendant shall receive credit for all time served. The conditions of supervised release entered in the original judgment and committal order dated 11/16/07 remain in full force and effect as to Marshall J. Washington (1). Ordered by Senior Judge Lyle E. Strom. (1 Certified copy to USM)(MKR)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:07-cr-00156; USA v. Washington et al;

The conditions of supervised release entered in the original judgment and committal order dated 11/16/07 remain in full force and effect as to Marshall J. Washington (1).
